\documentclass[11pt]{report}
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}

\usepackage[a4paper]{geometry}

% to use tikzit
\usepackage{tikzit}
%\input[/tikzit]{sample.tikzstyles}
% TiKZ style file generated by TikZiT. You may edit this file manually,
% but some things (e.g. comments) may be overwritten. To be readable in
% TikZiT, the only non-comment lines must be of the form:
% \tikzstyle{NAME}=[PROPERTY LIST]

% Node styles
\tikzstyle{red dot}=[fill=red, draw=black, shape=circle]
\tikzstyle{big circle}=[fill=none, draw={rgb,255: red,128; green,128; blue,128}, shape=circle, minimum width=1cm, minimum height=1cm]
\tikzstyle{little dot}=[fill=black, draw=black, shape=circle, inner sep=0.75pt]
\tikzstyle{little dot white inner}=[fill=white, draw=black, shape=circle, inner sep=0.75pt]
\tikzstyle{red font}=[fill=none, draw=none, shape=circle, text=red, tikzit fill=red]

% Edge styles
\tikzstyle{testline}=[<->, draw=black, fill=none]
\tikzstyle{red line}=[-, draw=red, thick]
\tikzstyle{line with arrow head}=[->]
\tikzstyle{dottet line}=[-, dashed]
\tikzstyle{orange line}=[-, draw={rgb,255: red,255; green,128; blue,0}, thick]
\tikzstyle{grey fill}=[-, fill={rgb,255: red,191; green,191; blue,191}]
\tikzstyle{thin green linee}=[-, draw=green, thin]
\tikzstyle{red line with arrow head}=[draw=red, ->]

% german hyphenation
\usepackage[german]{babel}


% for including figures with \includegraphics{}
\usepackage{graphicx}


% common packages used in maths
\usepackage{amsmath}
\usepackage{amsthm}
\usepackage{amssymb}
\usepackage{amsfonts}

% clickable links
\usepackage[hidelinks]{hyperref}


% roman enumerates
\usepackage{enumerate}


% defining the amsthm environments
% italics
\newtheorem{theorem}{Theorem}[chapter]
\newtheorem*{theorem*}{Theorem}
\newtheorem{proposition}{Proposition}[chapter]
\newtheorem*{proposition*}{Proposition}
\newtheorem{lemma}{Lemma}[chapter]
\newtheorem*{lemma*}{Lemma}
\newtheorem*{corollary*}{Korollar}
\newtheorem{corollary}{Korollar}[chapter]
\newtheorem*{claim}{Behauptung}
\newtheorem*{zusatz}{Zusatz}
\newtheorem*{satz}{Satz}

% upright
\theoremstyle{definition}
\newtheorem*{definition}{Definition}
\newtheorem*{definitions}{Definitionen}
\newtheorem*{remark}{Bemerkung}
\newtheorem*{remarks}{Bemerkungen}
\newtheorem*{warning}{Warnung}
\newtheorem*{exercise}{Übung}
\newtheorem*{example}{Beispiel}
\newtheorem*{examples}{Beispiele}
\newtheorem*{question}{Frage}
\newtheorem*{questions}{Fragen}
\newtheorem*{answer}{Antwort}
\newtheorem*{notation}{Notation}
\newtheorem*{specialcase}{Spezialfall}
\newtheorem*{specialcases}{Spezialfälle}
\newtheorem*{ausblick}{Ausblick}
\newtheorem*{goal}{Ziel}
\newtheorem*{ansatz}{Ansatz}
\newtheorem*{einschub}{Einschub}
\newtheorem*{summary}{Zusammenfassung}
\newtheorem*{applications}{Anwendungen}
\newtheorem*{application}{Anwendung}
\newtheorem*{geometric}{Geometrische Interpretation}
\newtheorem*{recall}{Erinnerung}
\newtheorem*{issues}{Probleme}
\newtheorem*{motivation}{Motivation}

% operators
\DeclareMathOperator{\im}{im}
\DeclareMathOperator{\bild}{Bild}
\DeclareMathOperator{\spann}{span}
\DeclareMathOperator{\Rang}{Rang}


% proper numbering (hide chapter number)
\renewcommand{\thelemma}{\arabic{lemma}}
\renewcommand{\theproposition}{\arabic{proposition}}
\renewcommand{\thetheorem}{\arabic{theorem}}
\renewcommand{\thecorollary}{\arabic{corollary}}

% for organising the document into multiple files
\usepackage{subfiles}


% fixing roman numerals in the table of contents
\usepackage[titles]{tocloft}
\renewcommand*\cftchapnumwidth{3em}
\renewcommand*\cftsecnumwidth{3em}

% removing chapter number from numbered equations
\usepackage{chngcntr}
\counterwithout{equation}{chapter}


\usepackage{tikz}
\usetikzlibrary{patterns}
\usetikzlibrary{calc}
\usepackage{standalone}

% gilles castel figures
\usepackage{import}
\usepackage{pdfpages}
\usepackage{transparent}
\usepackage{xcolor}
\newcommand{\incfig}[2][1]{%
    \def\svgwidth{#1\columnwidth}
}
\pdfsuppresswarningpagegroup=1

\begin{document}
\documentclass[../main.tex]{subfiles}
\end{document}
